chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Shepard-Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  DOC to collect from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Court will find defendant may participate in Intensive Drug Treatment Plan.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (25 pages) commencing SENTENCING HEARING 11/06/2014 received and filed.

COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.pk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in court with attorney Patrick C. Brennan.  Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court has reviewed the letters provided by the defense and the police reports provided by the state.  
Sentencing proceeded as to count 1.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 35 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 217 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 25 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Register as a sex offender.
-Court will find defendant may participate in Intensive Drug Treatment Program.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and is to be advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
received from defense counsel regarding letters for sentencing hearing, filed.
for PSI

As to count 1 of the AMENDED Information:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
As to counts 2-7 the court orders counts dismissed and read in for purposes of sentencing.  Also read in for sentencing will be uncharged MPD 14-1240045.
The court orders a PSI and remands the defendant pending sentencing on 11-6-2014 at 8:15.

Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in court with attorney Patrick C. Brennan.  Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed by the State as to count 1:
First Degree Sexual Assault-Contact with a Child under Age 13, a class B felony, 948.02(1)(e)
Counts 2-7 remain unchanged.
AMENDED Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Attorney Patrick C. Brennan in court, defendant Robert Shepard-Howard not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There is a joint request to set this matter for a change of plea hearing and to vacate the 9-8-2014 jury trial.
The Court will vacate the trial date and set matter for plea on 9-30-2014 at 8:15am.  The Court advises counsels that if this matter does NOT resolve on 9-30-14 it will be set for trial the following week.

Attorney Patrick C. Brennan in court, defendant Robert Shepard-Howard not in court, in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for Cynthia Davis for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting another final pretrial to meet with assigned ADA.  Case is adjourned to 9-3-2014 at 8:15 for final pretrial.

Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in court with attorney Patrick C Brennan.  Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Scheduling conference held.  Defense counsel requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Court orders any motions to be filed no later than 30 days from todays date and discovery to be completed no later than 45 days from todays date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Patrick C Brennan in court, defendant Robert Shepard-Howard not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for Miriam Falk for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Falk is in trial in Branch 25.  New charges have not been dictated yet; State is requesting additional time.  Case is adjourned to 5-29-2014 at 8:14 for scheduling conference.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing APRIL 23, 2014 received and filed. (20 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty Patrick Brennan  1110 N Old World Third Street  #200  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Attorney Patrick C Brennan in court, defendant Robert Shepard-Howard not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State will be filing additional charges and request that cases be consolidated.  Case is adjourned to 5-21-2014 at 8:15 for scheduling with new case.

Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in court with attorney Patrick C Brennan.  Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in custody.  Christopher Liegel for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Andrew Wagner.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard not in court, defendant in custody.  Assistant District Attorney Sara Lewis for Miriam Falk appeared earlier today for the State of Wisconsin.
Eli from Attorney Patrick Brennan's Office called to inform Preliminary Hearing Court that Attorney Brennan was not available for today's proceedings.  Eli represented to the Court that the State was aware of Attorney Brennan not being present.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DMM, his family, residence or school.

Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in court with attorney Patrick C. Brennan.  Defendant Robert Shepard-Howard in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant has retained private counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
